cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest across the eastern Caribbean, forecast to arc northwest then north toward the west coast of Florida and eventually the southeast United States coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: along the west coast of Florida (Big Bend region) before moving inland across Georgia

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch – southern Haiti; Tropical Storm Watch – Grenada, Saba & Sint Eustatius, Jamaica, Dominica
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning – Barbados, St. Lucia, St. Vincent & the Grenadines; Tropical Storm Warning – Martinique, southern Dominican Republic coast, entire coast of Haiti
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Windward Islands through the eastern Caribbean, then Cuba, Jamaica, Florida, and the southeast United States coastline including Georgia and South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible as the core or remnants pass inland on 7 July; probability remains low (9 %).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal rise 1–3 ft possible in the Savannah River mouth at time of closest approach if the center tracks just offshore.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with isolated higher totals could accompany outer rain-bands, producing localized ponding and brief flash-flood concerns.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain-bands and brief periods of reduced visibility for marine traffic.
